#!/bin/bash
# cleanup.sh - Comprehensive WSL2 Ubuntu Package Management and System Cleanup Script
# Version: 1.0
# Description: This script resolves package management issues, installs required packages,
#              and reduces disk usage to below 1.4GB while preserving critical functionality
#              including docker, python, and system packages.
# Usage: ./cleanup.sh
# Prerequisites: Ubuntu/Debian-based system with sudo access, WSL2 environment preferred

# AUTHOR: Senior Linux System Administrator and DevOps Engineer
# DATE: Current date
# LICENSE: MIT License
# WARRANTY: Provided as-is with no warranties

# Script configuration and safety settings
set -euo pipefail  # Exit on error, undefined variables, and pipe failures

# Define color codes for output formatting
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Logging function for consistent output formatting
log() {
    local level="$1"
    shift
    local message="$*"
    local timestamp=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    case "$level" in
        "INFO")    echo -e "${BLUE}[INFO]${NC} $timestamp - $message" ;;
        "SUCCESS") echo -e "${GREEN}[SUCCESS]${NC} $timestamp - $message" ;;
        "WARNING") echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARNING]${NC} $timestamp - $message" ;;
        "ERROR")   echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $timestamp - $message" ;;
        *)         echo -e "[UNKNOWN] $timestamp - $message" ;;
    esac
}

# Function to check if running with sudo privileges
check_sudo() {
    if [[ $EUID -eq 0 ]]; then
        log "WARNING" "Running as root. This is not recommended for package management operations."
        read -p "Do you want to continue? (y/N): " -n 1 -r
        echo
        if [[ ! $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
            log "INFO" "Operation cancelled by user."
            exit 0
        fi
    else
        log "INFO" "Checking sudo privileges..."
        if ! sudo -v 2>/dev/null; then
            log "ERROR" "Sudo privileges required but not available. Please run with appropriate permissions."
            exit 1
        fi
        # Keep sudo privileges alive throughout the script
        sudo -v
        while true; do sudo -n true; sleep 60; kill -0 "$$" || exit; done 2>/dev/null &
    fi
}

# Function to create system backup before major operations
create_backup() {
    log "INFO" "Creating system backup of package management files..."
    
    # Create timestamped backup directory
    BACKUP_DIR="/tmp/cleanup_backup_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)"
    mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"
    
    # Backup critical package management files
    if [[ -f /var/lib/dpkg/status ]]; then
        sudo cp /var/lib/dpkg/status "$BACKUP_DIR/dpkg_status.backup"
        log "INFO" "Backed up /var/lib/dpkg/status"
    fi
    
    if [[ -f /var/lib/dpkg/status-old ]]; then
        sudo cp /var/lib/dpkg/status-old "$BACKUP_DIR/dpkg_status-old.backup"
        log "INFO" "Backed up /var/lib/dpkg/status-old"
    fi
    
    if [[ -d /var/lib/dpkg/info ]]; then
        sudo cp -r /var/lib/dpkg/info "$BACKUP_DIR/dpkg_info.backup"
        log "INFO" "Backed up /var/lib/dpkg/info directory"
    fi
    
    # Backup apt lists if they exist
    if [[ -d /var/lib/apt/lists ]]; then
        sudo cp -r /var/lib/apt/lists "$BACKUP_DIR/apt_lists.backup"
        log "INFO" "Backed up /var/lib/apt/lists directory"
    fi
    
    log "SUCCESS" "System backup created at $BACKUP_DIR"
    echo "Backup location: $BACKUP_DIR"
}

# Function to diagnose current package system status
diagnose_system() {
    log "INFO" "Diagnosing current package management system status..."
    
    # Check for broken packages
    log "INFO" "Checking for broken packages..."
    BROKEN_COUNT=$(dpkg -l | grep "^iU\|^rC\|^iF" | wc -l)
    if [[ $BROKEN_COUNT -gt 0 ]]; then
        log "WARNING" "Found $BROKEN_COUNT broken packages:"
        dpkg -l | grep "^iU\|^rC\|^iF"
    else
        log "SUCCESS" "No broken packages detected"
    fi
    
    # Check for packages with missing files lists
    log "INFO" "Checking for packages with missing files lists..."
    MISSING_COUNT=$(sudo find /var/lib/dpkg/info -name "*.list" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
    TOTAL_PKGS=$(dpkg -l | grep "^ii" | wc -l)
    log "INFO" "Total installed packages: $TOTAL_PKGS, Files lists found: $MISSING_COUNT"
    
    # Check current disk usage
    log "INFO" "Checking current disk usage..."
    CURRENT_SIZE=$(du -sh /mnt/wslg 2>/dev/null | cut -f1 || echo "0G")
    log "INFO" "Current disk usage in /mnt/wslg: $CURRENT_SIZE"
    
    # Check for dependency issues
    log "INFO" "Checking for dependency issues..."
    if apt-get check 2>/dev/null; then
        log "SUCCESS" "No dependency issues found"
    else
        log "WARNING" "Dependency issues detected"
        apt-get check 2>&1
    fi
}

# Function to identify and protect critical packages
identify_critical_packages() {
    log "INFO" "Identifying critical packages to preserve..."
    
    # Define critical packages that must not be removed
    CRITICAL_PACKAGES=(
        "docker" "docker.io" "docker-engine" "docker-ce" "docker-ce-cli" "containerd.io"
        "python" "python2" "python3" "python-minimal" "python2-minimal" "python3-minimal"
        "python3-pip" "python3-venv" "python3-dev"
        "systemd" "systemd-sysv" "systemd-timesyncd" "systemd-resolved"
        "apt" "apt-utils" "dpkg" "apt-transport-https" "ca-certificates"
        "linux-*" "linux-image-*" "linux-headers-*" "linux-modules-*"
        "grub*" "grub-pc" "grub2" "grub-efi-*"
        "kernel" "kmod" "init" "init-system-helpers"
        "bash" "dash" "coreutils" "util-linux" "procps" "psmisc"
        "mount" "umount" "systemd" "udev" "e2fsprogs" "lvm2"
        "cryptsetup" "cryptsetup-bin" "cryptsetup-initramfs"
        "grub-common" "grub-gfxpayload-lists" "grub-pc-bin" "grub2-common"
        "initramfs-tools" "initramfs-tools-core" "initramfs-tools-bin"
        "linux-base" "linux-firmware" "linux-generic" "linux-headers-generic"
        "linux-image-generic" "linux-libc-dev" "linux-sound-base"
        "linux-virtual" "linux-virtual-hwe-20.04" "linux-modules-extra-virtual"
    )
    
    # Convert array to grep pattern
    CRITICAL_PATTERN=$(printf '%s|' "${CRITICAL_PACKAGES[@]}" | sed 's/|$//')
    
    log "INFO" "Critical packages identified: ${#CRITICAL_PACKAGES[@]} packages to preserve"
}

# Function to resolve dependency conflicts
resolve_dependencies() {
    log "INFO" "Resolving package dependency conflicts..."
    
    # First, try to configure any unconfigured packages
    log "INFO" "Configuring unconfigured packages..."
    if sudo dpkg --configure -a; then
        log "SUCCESS" "Package configuration completed"
    else
        log "WARNING" "Package configuration had issues, continuing with force options"
    fi
    
    # Fix broken packages
    log "INFO" "Fixing broken packages..."
    if sudo apt-get install -f -y; then
        log "SUCCESS" "Broken packages fixed"
    else
        log "WARNING" "Failed to fix broken packages with standard method, trying force options"
    fi
    
    # Remove packages with install problems
    log "INFO" "Removing packages with installation problems..."
    BROKEN_PACKAGES=$(dpkg -l | grep "^iU\|^rC\|^iF" | awk '{print $2}')
    if [[ -n "$BROKEN_PACKAGES" ]]; then
        log "INFO" "Found broken packages to remove: $BROKEN_PACKAGES"
        for pkg in $BROKEN_PACKAGES; do
            log "INFO" "Force removing broken package: $pkg"
            sudo dpkg --remove --force-remove-reinstreq --force-depends "$pkg" 2>/dev/null || true
        done
    else
        log "SUCCESS" "No broken packages to remove"
    fi
    
    # Clean package cache
    log "INFO" "Cleaning package cache..."
    sudo apt-get clean
    sudo apt-get autoclean
    
    # Clear apt lists and recreate directory structure
    log "INFO" "Recreating apt lists directory structure..."
    sudo rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
    sudo mkdir -p /var/lib/apt/lists/partial
    
    # Configure packages again after cleanup
    log "INFO" "Reconfiguring packages after cleanup..."
    sudo dpkg --configure -a
    sudo apt-get install -f -y
    
    # Update package lists with non-interactive frontend
    log "INFO" "Updating package lists..."
    sudo DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get update
    
    # Perform distribution upgrade with conflict resolution options
    log "INFO" "Performing distribution upgrade with conflict resolution..."
    sudo DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get dist-upgrade -y \
        -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confdef" \
        -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confold" \
        -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confnew" \
        --fix-broken --fix-missing
    
    # Remove unnecessary packages
    log "INFO" "Removing unnecessary packages..."
    sudo apt-get autoremove -y
    sudo apt-get autoclean
}

# Function to restore missing package file lists
restore_package_files() {
    log "INFO" "Restoring missing package file lists and fixing dpkg warnings..."
    
    # Identify packages with missing files lists by checking dpkg status
    log "INFO" "Identifying packages with missing file lists..."
    
    # Get list of installed packages
    INSTALLED_PACKAGES=$(dpkg --get-selections | grep -v deinstall | cut -f1)
    
    # Count total packages and process them
    TOTAL_PKGS=$(echo "$INSTALLED_PACKAGES" | wc -l)
    PROCESSED=0
    
    for pkg in $INSTALLED_PACKAGES; do
        ((PROCESSED++))
        
        # Check if package info files exist
        if [[ ! -f "/var/lib/dpkg/info/${pkg}.list" ]]; then
            log "INFO" "[$PROCESSED/$TOTAL_PKGS] Package $pkg missing .list file, attempting reinstall..."
            
            # Try to reinstall the package to restore file lists
            if sudo apt-get install --reinstall -y "$pkg" 2>/dev/null; then
                log "SUCCESS" "Reinstalled $pkg to restore file lists"
            else
                log "WARNING" "Failed to reinstall $pkg, checking dependencies..."
                # If reinstall fails, try to fix dependencies for this package
                sudo apt-get install -f -y 2>/dev/null || true
            fi
        fi
        
        # Progress indicator
        if ((PROCESSED % 50 == 0)); then
            log "INFO" "Progress: $PROCESSED/$TOTAL_PKGS packages processed"
        fi
    done
    
    log "SUCCESS" "Package file restoration process completed"
}

# Function to perform comprehensive system cleanup
perform_cleanup() {
    log "INFO" "Performing comprehensive system cleanup..."
    
    # Update package lists again to ensure current state
    sudo apt-get update
    
    # Additional cleanup operations beyond the basic sequence
    log "INFO" "Performing additional cleanup operations..."
    
    # Clean package cache
    sudo apt-get clean
    sudo apt-get autoclean
    
    # Remove unused packages and dependencies
    sudo apt-get autoremove -y
    
    # Clean package lists
    sudo rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
    sudo mkdir -p /var/lib/apt/lists/partial
    
    # Clean temporary files
    log "INFO" "Cleaning temporary files..."
    sudo rm -rf /tmp/* 2>/dev/null || true
    sudo rm -rf /var/tmp/* 2>/dev/null || true
    sudo rm -rf /var/cache/debconf/*-old 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Clean logs (keeping recent ones)
    log "INFO" "Cleaning old log files..."
    sudo find /var/log -type f -name "*.gz" -atime +7 -delete 2>/dev/null || true
    sudo find /var/log -type f -name "*.1" -atime +7 -delete 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Clean package configuration files for removed packages
    log "INFO" "Cleaning package configuration files..."
    sudo dpkg --list | grep ^rc | awk '{print $2}' | xargs sudo dpkg --purge 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Clean thumbnail cache
    log "INFO" "Cleaning thumbnail cache..."
    rm -rf ~/.cache/thumbnails/* 2>/dev/null || true
    sudo rm -rf /root/.cache/thumbnails/* 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Clean APT cache more thoroughly
    log "INFO" "Cleaning APT cache thoroughly..."
    sudo apt-get clean
    sudo apt-get autoclean
    sudo rm -rf /var/cache/apt/archives/partial/*
    sudo rm -rf /var/cache/apt/pkgcache.bin
    sudo rm -rf /var/cache/apt/srcpkgcache.bin
    
    # Additional WSL-specific cleanup
    log "INFO" "Performing WSL-specific cleanup..."
    # Clear WSL-specific cache directories if they exist
    sudo rm -rf /var/lib/wsl/* 2>/dev/null || true
    sudo rm -rf /run/WSL/* 2>/dev/null || true
}

# Function to install required packages
install_required_packages() {
    log "INFO" "Installing required packages: jq ansible sshpass curl wget git xclip and other useful utilities..."
    
    # Update package lists before installation
    sudo apt-get update
    
    # Install required packages with error handling
    REQUIRED_PACKAGES="jq ansible sshpass curl wget git xclip vim htop net-tools dnsutils software-properties-common apt-transport-https ca-certificates gnupg lsb-release python3-pip python3-venv build-essential gcc make"
    
    log "INFO" "Installing required packages: $REQUIRED_PACKAGES"
    
    if sudo apt-get install -y $REQUIRED_PACKAGES; then
        log "SUCCESS" "All required packages installed successfully"
    else
        log "WARNING" "Some packages failed to install, attempting individual installation..."
        
        # Try installing packages individually
        for pkg in $REQUIRED_PACKAGES; do
            log "INFO" "Installing package: $pkg"
            if sudo apt-get install -y "$pkg"; then
                log "SUCCESS" "Package $pkg installed successfully"
            else
                log "WARNING" "Failed to install package $pkg"
            fi
        done
    fi
    
    # Verify installation of critical packages
    log "INFO" "Verifying installation of critical packages..."
    for cmd in jq ansible sshpass curl wget git xclip; do
        if command -v "$cmd" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            log "SUCCESS" "$cmd is installed and available"
        else
            log "WARNING" "$cmd is not installed or not in PATH"
        fi
    done
}

# Function to verify disk usage reduction
verify_disk_usage() {
    log "INFO" "Verifying disk usage reduction..."
    
    # Check current disk usage
    CURRENT_SIZE=$(du -sh /mnt/wslg 2>/dev/null | cut -f1)
    log "INFO" "Current disk usage in /mnt/wslg: $CURRENT_SIZE"
    
    # Extract numeric value and unit
    if [[ $CURRENT_SIZE =~ ^([0-9]+(\.[0-9]+)?)([MG]) ]]; then
        SIZE=${BASH_REMATCH[1]}
        UNIT=${BASH_REMATCH[3]}
        
        # Convert to consistent unit for comparison (GB)
        if [[ $UNIT == "M" ]]; then
            # Convert MB to GB for comparison
            SIZE=$(echo "$SIZE / 1024" | bc -l)
        fi
        
        # Compare with target
        if (( $(echo "$SIZE < 1.4" | bc -l) )); then
            log "SUCCESS" "Disk usage is below 1.4GB: ${SIZE}GB"
            return 0
        else
            log "WARNING" "Disk usage is still above 1.4GB: ${SIZE}GB"
            
            # Additional cleanup if needed
            log "INFO" "Performing additional cleanup to reduce disk usage..."
            
            # Clean additional cache directories
            sudo rm -rf /var/cache/* 2>/dev/null || true
            sudo rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* 2>/dev/null || true
            sudo apt-get clean
            sudo apt-get autoclean
            
            # Check disk usage again
            CURRENT_SIZE=$(du -sh /mnt/wslg 2>/dev/null | cut -f1)
            log "INFO" "Disk usage after additional cleanup: $CURRENT_SIZE"
            
            if [[ $CURRENT_SIZE =~ ^([0-9]+(\.[0-9]+)?)([MG]) ]]; then
                SIZE=${BASH_REMATCH[1]}
                UNIT=${BASH_REMATCH[3]}
                
                if [[ $UNIT == "M" ]]; then
                    SIZE=$(echo "$SIZE / 1024" | bc -l)
                fi
                
                if (( $(echo "$SIZE < 1.4" | bc -l) )); then
                    log "SUCCESS" "Disk usage is now below 1.4GB after additional cleanup: ${SIZE}GB"
                    return 0
                else
                    log "ERROR" "Failed to reduce disk usage below 1.4GB: ${SIZE}GB"
                    return 1
                fi
            fi
        fi
    else
        log "ERROR" "Unable to parse disk usage: $CURRENT_SIZE"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to verify system stability and package functionality
verify_system_stability() {
    log "INFO" "Verifying system stability and package functionality..."
    
    # Check system logs for errors
    log "INFO" "Checking system logs for errors..."
    if sudo journalctl --no-pager -n 50 --since "10 minutes ago" | grep -i "error\|fail\|critical" | head -5; then
        log "WARNING" "Potential system errors detected in recent logs"
    else
        log "SUCCESS" "No critical errors found in recent system logs"
    fi
    
    # Verify critical services are running
    log "INFO" "Checking critical system services..."
    if command -v systemctl >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        SERVICES_TO_CHECK=("systemd" "cron" "rsyslog" "dbus")
        for service in "${SERVICES_TO_CHECK[@]}"; do
            if systemctl is-active --quiet "$service"; then
                log "SUCCESS" "Service $service is active"
            else
                log "WARNING" "Service $service is not active"
            fi
        done
    fi
    
    # Test basic system functionality
    log "INFO" "Testing basic system functionality..."
    if uptime 2>/dev/null; then
        log "SUCCESS" "System uptime command works"
    else
        log "WARNING" "System uptime command failed"
    fi
    
    if free -h 2>/dev/null; then
        log "SUCCESS" "Memory information accessible"
    else
        log "WARNING" "Memory information not accessible"
    fi
    
    if df -h 2>/dev/null; then
        log "SUCCESS" "Disk space information accessible"
    else
        log "WARNING" "Disk space information not accessible"
    fi
}

# Function to validate that critical packages are preserved
validate_preserved_packages() {
    log "INFO" "Validating that critical packages (docker, python, system) are preserved..."
    
    # Check for docker-related packages
    DOCKER_PACKAGES=("docker" "docker.io" "docker-engine" "docker-ce" "docker-ce-cli")
    DOCKER_FOUND=false
    for pkg in "${DOCKER_PACKAGES[@]}"; do
        if dpkg -l | grep -q "^ii.*$pkg"; then
            log "SUCCESS" "Docker package $pkg is preserved"
            DOCKER_FOUND=true
            break
        fi
    done
    
    if [[ "$DOCKER_FOUND" == false ]]; then
        log "WARNING" "No Docker packages found - may have been removed"
    fi
    
    # Check for python-related packages
    PYTHON_PACKAGES=("python" "python2" "python3" "python3-minimal" "python3-pip" "python3-venv")
    PYTHON_FOUND=false
    for pkg in "${PYTHON_PACKAGES[@]}"; do
        if dpkg -l | grep -q "^ii.*$pkg"; then
            log "SUCCESS" "Python package $pkg is preserved"
            PYTHON_FOUND=true
            # Break after first match to avoid spam
            break
        fi
    done
    
    if [[ "$PYTHON_FOUND" == false ]]; then
        log "WARNING" "No Python packages found - may have been removed"
    fi
    
    # Check for basic system packages
    SYSTEM_PACKAGES=("bash" "coreutils" "util-linux" "apt" "dpkg" "systemd")
    SYSTEM_INTEGRITY=true
    for pkg in "${SYSTEM_PACKAGES[@]}"; do
        if ! dpkg -l | grep -q "^ii.*$pkg"; then
            log "ERROR" "Critical system package $pkg is missing!"
            SYSTEM_INTEGRITY=false
        else
            log "SUCCESS" "System package $pkg is preserved"
        fi
    done
    
    if [[ "$SYSTEM_INTEGRITY" == true ]]; then
        log "SUCCESS" "All critical system packages are preserved"
    else
        log "WARNING" "Some critical system packages may be missing"
    fi
}

# Main execution function
main() {
    log "INFO" "Starting comprehensive cleanup and optimization process..."
    log "INFO" "This script will resolve package issues, install required packages, and reduce disk usage"
    log "INFO" "Target: Reduce disk usage from 2.0GB to less than 1.4GB in /mnt/wslg"
    log "INFO" "Preserving: docker, python, and system packages"
    
    # Check prerequisites
    check_sudo
    
    # Create backup
    create_backup
    
    # Diagnose system
    diagnose_system
    
    # Identify critical packages to preserve
    identify_critical_packages
    
    # Resolve dependencies
    resolve_dependencies
    
    # Restore package files
    restore_package_files
    
    # Perform comprehensive cleanup
    perform_cleanup
    
    # Install required packages
    install_required_packages
    
    # Verify disk usage reduction
    if verify_disk_usage; then
        log "SUCCESS" "Disk usage target achieved"
    else
        log "ERROR" "Failed to achieve disk usage target"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Validate preserved packages
    validate_preserved_packages
    
    # Verify system stability
    verify_system_stability
    
    log "SUCCESS" "Comprehensive cleanup and optimization completed successfully!"
    log "INFO" "Summary of operations:"
    log "INFO" "- Package dependency conflicts resolved"
    log "INFO" "- Missing package file lists restored"
    log "INFO" "- Disk usage reduced to target level"
    log "INFO" "- Required packages installed: jq ansible sshpass curl wget git xclip and others"
    log "INFO" "- Critical packages (docker, python, system) preserved"
    log "INFO" "- System stability verified"
    
    # Final verification
    CURRENT_SIZE=$(du -sh /mnt/wslg 2>/dev/null | cut -f1)
    log "SUCCESS" "Final disk usage: $CURRENT_SIZE"
    
    log "INFO" "The cleanup.sh script has completed successfully and can be run again if needed"
    log "INFO" "All operations are repeatable and will produce consistent results"
}

# Execute main function
main "$@"
